programme.desc: Capri ep2 - Anacapri: Gianfranco passeggia in un piccolo orto biologico tra pomodori, carciofi, piselli, limoni. Qui assaggerà delle tagliatelle al limone, poi procederà nella sua ricerca di piccole botteghe e gastronomie.

programme.title: Il gusto di Igles
programme.desc: S11 - La cucina circolare di Igles Corelli è una cucina zero sprechi. Ricette e consigli pratici per una sfruttare al massimo e senza sprechi gli ingredienti.

programme.title: Beker on tour
programme.desc: Mandi strada del vino - Il viaggio di Fabrizio Nonis in Friuli Venezia Giulia. Un patrimonio culturale e gastronomico tutto da scoprire attraverso la strada del vino.

programme.title: La cucina delle ragazze
programme.desc: S.6 - Sara e Laura sono grandi amiche e condividono una forte passione: la cucina. Laura, marchigiana, e Sara, romana, propongono le ricette più gustose delle rispettive regioni.

programme.title: Mangio tutto tranne Portogallo
programme.desc: Centro del Portogallo Ep2 - Giovanni Angelucci, gastronomo viaggiatore, questa volta in Portogallo. Un reportage di gusto e cultura in compagnia di questo coloratissimo paese

programme.title: Christmas With Bonacini
programme.desc: Christmas with Bonacini is a charming one-hour holiday special featuring celebrity chef Michael Bonacini and his son Oscar. Michael inspires with his favourite Christmas recipes that will add a twinkle of sophistication to your dinner table while lifting holiday spirits.

programme.title: Spencer's Holiday BBQ
programme.desc: Join charismatic chef Spencer Watts at his glorious rooftop patio for a one-hour special featuring a full holiday spread, all made on the BBQ. Spencer’s festive menu is all about creative BBQ twists with his delectable, mouth-watering recipes including Burnt Orange Cranberry Marmalade, Maple Rye Pumpkin Pie, and Asparagus with Smoked Salmon Dip. Save room for the piece de Q-sistance: Smoked Turkey Two Ways. This year, take your holiday feast outside and serve up something deliciously different.

programme.title: Flour Power Holiday Specials
programme.desc: Christmas is near, and the pressure is on! Between work, home, friends, and family, the list of people to buy for is endless. To help us through this busy time, FLOUR POWER CHRISTMAS: EDIBLE GIFTS offers up four creative and more personal options to make the holidays cheaper, sweeter, and filled with love. Fun host Jessica McGovern shows us how to bake something for everyone including Crispy Brittle Bark covered in chocolate, rich Coal Cookies that are sweet with a bit of heat, adorable peanut butter-chocolate Reindeer Cupcakes, and easy-to-make Christmas Puzzle Cookies.

programme.title: One World Kitchen Bakes the Holidays
programme.desc: Celebrate the holidays with One World Kitchen's baked treats from Italy, Japan, Thailand, and Argentina. Our hosts Vanessa, Hana, Pailin, and Natalia put a global twist on classic recipes with Panforte, honey-drizzled Struffoli, Matcha Cheesecake, Thai Shortbread Cookies, TurrÃ³n, and Pan Dulce. Our warm hosts serve up sweet treats inspired by traditions and family secrets. One World Kitchen: Bakes the Holidays will put you in the festive spirit and bring new holiday traditions to your home!

programme.title: BLITZ'N
programme.desc: Get ready for a special holiday BLITZ! with master mixologist Yvonne Langen as she prepares her favorite holiday cocktails and party snacks in the Gusto TV kitchen!

programme.title: Watts Up for the Holidays
programme.desc: Spencer Watts serves up his take on traditional holiday fare, showing us that you can make an impressive dinner without the stress. In this cheerful one-hour special, charming bachelor Spencer takes you through all the planning tips and lets you in on his secrets to create the ultimate holiday meal.

programme.title: Flour Power Holiday Specials
programme.desc: Christmas is right around the corner and it calls for a little fun - like a twist on traditional holiday desserts! FLOUR POWER CHRISTMAS: TWISTS ON THE CLASSICS offers a new take on some of your favourites to bring you a fresh perspective and world of flavour for the holidays! Enchanting host Jessica McGovern plays off classic desserts, serving up handy hints on how to get the most out of every bite. From sweet and fluffy Gumdrop Cakes drizzled with a light lemony glaze to a delectable Eggnog Ski Slope Cake decorated with rosemary trees and a few friends to hit the hills, Jessica's unique holiday recipes will surly make it on your list of Christmas traditions!

programme.title: One World Kitchen: Our Favourite Holiday Recipes
programme.desc: In this special holiday episode of One World Kitchen, Hana (Japan), Vanessa (Italy), Natalia (Argentina), and Pailin (Thailand) get together to cook their favorite traditional holiday dishes influenced by their respective cultures. Christmas Sushi Rolls, Veal in a Creamy Tuna Sauce with Capers, Striped Bass in Garlic and Lime Marinade, and an epic Timballo. For the final recipe, our hosts combine all the flavors of One World Kitchen into a truly internationally-inspired turkey dish.

programme.title: Bonacini's Italian Christmas
programme.desc: BONACINI'S ITALIAN CHRISTMAS is a heartwarming one-hour holiday special featuring celebrity Chef Michael Bonacini as he shares some of his favourite Italian Christmas Eve dishes. Michael invites us to the set of his series "Bonacini's Italy" to cook up traditional Italian fare like Salt Cod Mousse on Polenta Crostini and Pork Braised in Milk. Michael takes us on a holiday culinary journey as he explores homey Christmas flavours and traditions, offering tips for perfecting dishes from the regions of Veneto, Sardinia, Calabria, Sicily, and Emilia Romagna.

programme.title: Flour Power Holiday Specials
programme.desc: The holidays are here! And the holidays come with a lineup of treats you won't be able to resist! From sweet and salty to traditional and unconventional, FLOUR POWER CHRISTMAS: BIG WOW DESSERTS covers it all. To get in the holiday spirit, enchanting host Jessica McGovern introduces two desserts that could impress any Scrooge. First, Jessica bakes a decadent Chocolate Yule Log stuffed with a creamy Salted Caramel Frosting and finishes with a holiday-inspired cake decorated with homemade peppermint candy canes! Interwoven with tricks of the trade, Jessica guides us through her simple yet inspiring treats that are perfect for a big Christmas celebration.

programme.title: Spencer's Big Holiday
programme.desc: No matter how you celebrate the holidays, let Spencer Watts help you plan the menu, in SPENCER’S BIG HOLIDAY! In this festive one-hour holiday special, Spencer Watts is serving up some of his favourite holiday meals, treats, and drinks. Follow Spencer as he shows us how to sail through the hectic holiday season with style, from brunch to the moment the clock strikes midnight.

programme.title: One BIG Holiday Recipe
programme.desc: One BIG Recipe is all about cooking for family and friends and so are the holidays! Check out cool chef Kimberly Lallouz's take on holiday favourites in this special seasonal episode. Her first course is a Moroccan spiced Beet Latke with lightly dressed greens and creme fraiche. Next, whole fennel is braised tender, gratineed and spiked with apple chutney. Entrees include a one-of-a-king Turkey Breast 'Buche de Noel' roulade and a juicy, beefy espresso-red wine spiked Brisket roast. Along with her main course come her unique, single-serving Stuffin' muffins, two sauces, sugar snap peas and watermelon radishes. And don't leave without her sweet hostess gifts, White Chocolate Brittle-Bark...

programme.desc: Gusto TV’s Wizard of Whatever, Chef Kyle Crawford, is dishing up a holiday feast! There’ll be food, fun, elves… and even jolly old St. Nick himself may make an appearance! Join in as Kyle cooks up a Christmas goose complete with stuffing and gravy, plus all the sides and salads, and even a flashy flambé dessert! Merry whatever!

programme.title: Michael Bonacini's Christmas at the Farm
programme.desc: In this heartwarming holiday special, Chef Michael Bonacini invites us to his cozy farmhouse in Ontario for a charming Christmas feast. In this scenic winter retreat, Bonacini interprets classic Welsh and Italian Christmas dishes from his childhood. Michael cooks up comforting dishes from hearty potato leek soup, to succulent roast lamb, to classic molten chocolate lava cake. As he explores homey Christmas flavours, Michael shares his traditions and gives tips for perfecting the holiday meal.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.desc: Warm host Amanda Herrera picks up colourful produce and herbs at a farmers' market to make a delicious appetizer and tasty cold oil French fries.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.desc: Host Amanda Herrera transforms fresh market ingredients into two irresistible dishes, including a one pot Lamb Curry with Honeycomb.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.desc: Host Amanda Herrera grills up two dinner recipes using patty pan summer squash and cabbage that she picked up from the market.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Red curry is the star attraction in a stellar line-up of dishes Thai chef Pailin Chongchitnant makes, starting at red curry paste, and making her way to fish custard, chicken stir fry, and red curry duck.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Eggs are the linking ingredient between green beans ranch-style, zucchini quiche, stuffed beef flank, and vanilla custard with dulce leche, all prepared by award-winning Argentinian chef Natalia Machado.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Italian chef and foodie Vanessa Gianfrancesco shows us how to make dishes delicious enough for a fine restaurant with fried zucchini blossoms, spaghetti carbonara, roast lamb, and fruit crostata.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef and culinary instructor Hana Etsuko Dethlefsen shows us Japanese cuisine inspired by other cultures with a pork and tofu dish, sesame chicken salad, breaded pork cutlet, and even a French crepe.

programme.title: Global Veggies
programme.desc: Chef Pino Di Cerbo creates veggie dishes inspired by China, Canada, Peru, and Mexico!

programme.title: Global Veggies
programme.desc: Chef Pino Di Cerbo creates veggie dishes inspired by the USA, Canada, Mexico, and Suriname!

programme.desc: Chef Pino Di Cerbo creates veggie dishes inspired by Turkey, Honduras, China, and Nigeria!

programme.desc: On today's Fresh Market Dinners menu, host Amanda Herrera prepares succulent burgers with golden fries and a refreshing cocktail.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.desc: Using cream, sunflower oil and cherry tomatoes from the market, host Amanda Herrera makes an irresistible pasta recipe and indulgent dessert.

programme.title: Holiday Eatz
programme.desc: Get your 'Gobble Gobble' on with this special episode of Holiday Eatz, featuring fun and charming host Kimberly Lallouz! She starts her terrific Turkey Day menu with a harvest happy Kale Salad heaped with beets, candied pecans, toasted lentils, and goat cheese. Thanksgiving dinner needs Hot Rolls, Chef Lallouz packs hers with cranberries and corn, then serves them as a standalone course with a cheesy, creamy Mushroom Fondue! Next, it's time to talk turkey with a trick that cuts your poultry cooking time in half! Her Spatchcock Turkey is not just faster than old school, it's yummier too, with a garlic-herb marinade and a unique side of mixed beans and rice! Candied sweet potatoes and...

programme.title: Flour Power Holiday Specials
programme.desc: In preparation for a relaxing holiday with friends and family, FLOUR POWER THANKSGIVING: PIES GALORE invites you into the kitchen to bring a twist to your Thanksgiving classics. In this holiday special, host Jessica McGovern takes us through three new and exciting treats to bring to your table, sharing some of her favourite tips and tricks along the way. Jessica offers up three alternatives to a standard Thanksgiving dessert - serving up light and flaky Pie Fries with Apple Caramel Dip, a rich and creamy Sweet Potato Pie, and a luscious Vanilla Bourbon Sweet Potato Pie Cake coated in a fluffy marshmallow frosting. These quick and easy recipes will put you in the holiday spirit while...

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Vanessa Gianfrancesco uses culinary influences from the island of Sicily.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Citrus-based ponzu sauce is a favourite in Japanese cuisine, and Chef Hana Etsuko Dethlefsen shows us how to use it, starting with ceviche, then a hotpot, wagyu steak, and ending with shortcake.

programme.title: Global Veggies
programme.desc: Chef Pino Di Cerbo creates veggie dishes inspired by Lebanon, Mexico, Greece, and the UK!

programme.title: Global Veggies
programme.desc: Chef Pino Di Cerbo creates veggie dishes inspired by Italy, the USA, Ukraine, and Portugal!

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Greek expert Joanna Chery showcases unique recipes from the island of Crete. To start, she whips up a creamy Cretan Meat Pie. Sweet ricotta, tender lamb, and an aromatic bundle of spices covered in a flaky Greek yoghurt pie dough might be the best Greek comfort food. Next, Joanna makes Grouper with Okra - a light and healthy dish featuring flaky sea bass, fresh okra, and delicious potatoes. Then, she prepares a dish that's traditionally served at weddings - Gamopilafo. It's a fluffy, citrusy, rice pilaf topped with crispy, juicy chicken that will have you going back for seconds! For dessert, a popular Cretan treat called Baklava. Joanna expertly layers crispy, golden-brown phyllo pastry...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: Up the Dish host Micah Trainor tries her hand at an Italian original - Veal Piccata! Lemony, buttery, capERS-y veal melts in the mouth after being pounded supERS-thin and seared to perfection. Poppy Sandler's sideways switch-up is a Caper Almond Crusted Halibut, sizzled and baked until gorgeously golden-brown and flaky, then garnished with chives and pea shoots. Next, Missy Hui goes Greek with her vegetarian Avgolemono, a silky-smooth citrusy soup starring lemon and egg, garnished with orzo and shimeji mushrooms. Tiera Singh ties it all together with her Sumac Veal Sweetbreads with a rough chopped caperberry-olive tapenade - browned veal sweetbreads are sprinkled with tart sumac and laid...

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Host Joanna Chery elevates four Greek dishes using wine and spirits in this episode of One World Kitchen. First up, brown rice Stuffed Mussels infused with Greek dry white wine, tangy lemon juice, and fragrant spices - perfect for a sunny day by the sea. When evening rolls around, Joanna insists that red wine is a must! She makes a Sausage and Pepper Stew packed with golden-brown sausages and colourful bell peppers simmered in yummy tomatoes and a healthy dose of red wine. Then, she pulls out some brandy for a tender and delicious Beef Orzo Casserole. Finally, Joanna uses a traditional licorice-flavoured spirit called ouzo to bake a mouth-watering batch of Drunk Cookies.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Home cook Joanna Chery prepares a series of traditional Greek dishes including Stuffed Vine Leaves - a classic dish made of lemon-doused grape leaves and stuffed with fluffy rice, fragrant herbs, and juicy beef. Then, she prepares a healthy and hearty dish called Giant Baked Beans. Typically used as a side, it pairs well with Jo- anna's next dish - succulent roast lamb and lemony potatoes. Finally, Joanna makes a Greek specialty - Fried Dough Ribbons. Satisfy your sweet tooth with these fried, coiled dough ribbons drizzled with sweet honey and sprinkled with sugar. Simple, fun, and evERS-popular in Greek cuisine, this dish is great for sharing amongst family and friends.

programme.title: Bring On The Karbs
programme.desc: Chefs Erica and Josh Karbelnik go head-to-head to see who can come up with the most tantalizing soup and sandwich! Josh makes a chicken satay sandwich and coconut tamarind soup while Erica prepares lamb kofta and carrot ginger soup!

programme.title: DNA Dinners
programme.desc: Endearing host Tyrone Edwards surprises South African-born Shameen Miller with the results of her DNA test. Shameen cooks a meal that combines her two cultures and shares it with her family.

programme.title: DNA Dinners
programme.desc: Host Tyrone Edwards shocks Andrea Titus with her DNA results. Blending her two cultures onto one plate, Andrea then cooks up a delicious and revealing meal for her family.

programme.desc: Champagne, lobster, and homemade scones, oh my! Host Vanessa Gianfrancesco cooks up an indulgent and luxurious brunch that's perfect for those fabulous mid-mornings.

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: In this episode of Up the Dish, host Micah Trainor takes a stab at Cassoulet with buttery white beans, duck leg confit, and flavourful French sausage - and the result is mouth-wateringly good! The pressure's on, but Tiera Singh doesn't let up with her Chinese Long Bean Stir Fry. Succulent sausage, delicious duck breast, and flavorful vegetables come together for a truly sumptuous dish! For her vegetarian variant, Missy Hui must move things up a notch, but how? Agedashi Tofu! Breaded crispy semi-firm tofu is doused in a dashi, gochujang, and mirin mixture for the ultimate umami mouthful. Poppy Sandler goes above and beyond with her Chocolate-crusted Elk Loin, seared and drizzled with a...

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: Culinary expert Theresa Visintin picks the letter "B" and must combine beef with buttermilk for her challenge. But first, she works with the ingredients separately. Silky buttermilk lends itself perfectly to Theresa's battered blooming onion recipe. Using the biggest onion she can find, Theresa skillfully slices from the root down, ensuring it will bloom into a beautiful flower. She coats the Vidalia onion in egg, buttermilk and smoky spiced flour, before deep frying it. Next up, it's time for beef to get the Theresa treatment, as she prepares a crowd favourite- smoky, juicy, fall-off-thebone baked beef brisket. With the perfect balance of sweet and spicy, this meal will make you look...

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: After picking "M" for this episode's challenge, Chef Lauren Gulyas decides to make meal magic using maple and mahi-mahi. She starts by combining chestnut and quinoa to create a mouth-watering medley, rich in flavour and texture. Chef Lauren adds shiitake mushrooms and drizzles the dish with a balsamic vinegar, maple syrup and rosemary dressing. Next up, she steams Mahi-mahi with red chilies and lemongrass, this savoury spice is a heavenly combination with an invigorating aroma. For the challenge, Chef Lauren seamlessly introduces both maple and mahimahi into one flavourful fusion.

programme.title: DNA Dinners

programme.title: America From Above
programme.desc: Part one of a new series of ambient drone films for relaxation, America From Above is a spectacular yet ultra-soothing 1-hour long natural journey that sweeps viewers gently above America's vistas. programme.title: Xplore Belgium
programme.desc: Market square of Bruges is lined up with restaurants and cafes. The city is also home to golden fries or french fries, but are originated in Belgium.

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.desc: In the Troodos ranges of Cyprus, Sabrina Chakici visits the Kykkos Monastery and the ten small village churches, which have become a UNESCO World Heritage Site. She further ventures out to explore the Neolithic village of Khirokitia and learn about the age-old lace tradition in Lefkara village.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: Khad Maas is a celebrated Rajasthani dish with war-time origins. Game meat used to be slow-cooked in underground pits created to ensure that the fire could not be seen by enemy troops. Due to its intricate and cumbersome preparation, the dish seldom graces tables in Rajasthan today. Alex learns how to prepare this with the cultural conservationist, Trivikram.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Explore the beautiful Dalmatian coast with a little history of Split with Alex and stay tuned as next she explores the port city of Salona.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.desc: Tea in Japan is a spiritual concept. Attaching ritual and ceremony to it, this country transforms the act of drinking tea to a moment of communion with the universe. Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty find out different ways to relish Gyokuro tea, one of the highest grades of tea available in Japan. They also visit the village where it is grown.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico
programme.desc: From dolphin-filled lagoons to colonial charm, Charlie introduces the treasures of the least visited state on the Yucatan peninsula, Campeche.

programme.title: Xplore Belgium
programme.desc: Renowned as the world's leading city of diamonds, it also holds about possessing the second largest port in whole of Europe.

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.desc: Lying next to the island's beautiful Mediterranean coastline, in south-western Cyprus, the popular town of Paphos is home to some spectacular archaeological attractions and a rich Cypriot history. Here, Sabrina discovers the myths of the Greek and Roman philosophies, unravels the stories hidden in time at Paphos Archaeological Park, and explores the historic towns of Limassol and Kourion.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: The sheer ingenuity and artistry of Rajasthani cuisine is an enduring testament to the skill and grim determination of the people who have made their homes in this largely arid land. Alex finds out that this applies to the imperial cuisine of the state as well, when she meets Trivikram and learns from him how to prepare a traditional meat dish, that was made using meat leftovers.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Watch a musical instrument powered by sea waves and learn how glassware was made in Roman era. This and more with Alexandra in Zadar episode

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.desc: Among Japan’s best kept secrets is its very own Venice with an oriental flavour to it. Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty visit this hidden gem, and learn a little about Kyushu’s history and Samurai, the legendary Japanese warriors. They also witness an enchanting garden, that is the perfect combination of the creativity of nature and human beings.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico
programme.desc: In the historic city of Merida, Charlie shows around the underground pools, which narrate stories of Mayan beliefs.

programme.title: Xplore Belgium
programme.desc: Antwerp has grown on the banks of the Scheldt River that alongwith the Meuse and the Rhine forms the biggest estuary in western Europe.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico
programme.desc: Secret diving spots, under-the-radar lagoons, ancient Mayan ruins – there is a lot more to the Yucatan peninsula than Cancun and Playa del Carmen.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Alexandra in this episode explores Plitvice, where she visits a national park, interacts with locals, tastes local wine and then leaves for Zagreb.

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.desc: From being the primary mode of transport for many centuries to helping in the production of olive oil, the donkeys in Cyprus have truly earned the status of the national animal. Our host, Sabrina Chakici finds out more about them and their significance to the country when she visits a donkey farm. She also visits Akamas Peninsula National Park, one of the island country’s last remaining wildernesses.

programme.title: Xplore Belgium
programme.desc: No matter where you look, you will see impressive, interesting architecture that will catch your eye. Until 1550 Ghent was one of the largest cities.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.desc: Daniel Coll and Paddy Doherty pay a visit to the award-winning swordsmith, Matsunaga Genrokuro in the city of Arao in Kyushu, Japan. He shows them a few things about making the swords used by the Samurai, and how to wield them. They also explore some hidden Christian sites in the Nagasaki region.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: After finding his grandparents’ handwritten recipes, Vikramaditya Sodawas, the owner of Karni Fort, decided to revive his family’s prized recipes.

programme.title: Bliss
programme.desc: Most popular destinations of Santorini's main island are the volcano and the hot spring.This is best way to explore this island is on foot.

programme.title: Best From The Rest
programme.desc: From the Rainbow village to the Sun Moon Lake, Taiwan offers different experiences that exude the beauty and spirit of the country.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico
programme.desc: Charlie introduces the indigenous handicrafts of Oaxaca, including the whimsical creatures with a unique story.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: Hungry for stories and flavours of a bygone kingdom, Alex meets Rana Sawai Harisingh II, the 24th descendant to the royal family of Begu.

programme.title: Timeless Tamil Nadu
programme.desc: In the 8th century AD, a town on the Coromandel coast became a lab for the kings of the Pallava dynasty to conduct their architectural experiments. Centuries later, Alex visits the world-famous rock-cut temples and cave shrines of Mahabalipuram to explore the styles of architecture that were innovated by kings, who are often called the pioneers of South Indian architecture.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.desc: Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty visit Meiji-Gura in Kyushu, Japan, to taste a locally brewed Japanese hard liquor, Shochu. They also go to the Makurazaki region for a special meal of bonito, a Japanese seafood delicacy, prepared for them by world-class chefs, Gaggan Anand and Takeshi “Goh” Fukuyama.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico
programme.desc: Charlie’s journey across Mexico begins in La Paz, a quiet escape sitting on the Sea of Cortez that is often overshadowed by Cabo

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.desc: Larnaca in Cyprus is one of the world’s 20 most ancient, continuously inhabited cities for the last 4000 years. Travel enthusiast, Sabrina sets out to find out more about the city but is waylaid when she finds a flock of flamingos at a lake side.

programme.title: Xplore Belgium
programme.desc: The food, the beers, the chocolate and the fries. Bruges is one of the cities that seemed to have skipped 21st century altogether.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: Bengal has not only been home to the former capital of British India but also been the land where many European colonies vied for dominance and cultural supremacy. As a result, the cuisine of the land underwent a renaissance, wherein it imbibed many European influences including Portuguese, Dutch and Danish. Alex visits what used to be a Danish settlement on the banks of the river Hooghly, and she unearths recipes, which were born from this delicious amalgamation of cultures.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Alexandra, in this episode visits Dubrovnik, where she explores a war museum, the dramatic monuments, mesmerising landscapes and tries water sports.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.desc: While the rest of Japan remained isolated from the world, Fukuoka’s global flavour was concocted by centuries of trade with its Asian neighbours. Adventurers, Daniel Coll and Paddy Doherty attend a unique baseball game at a rather offbeat stadium in Kyushu’s largest city.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico
programme.desc: People flock to Cabo for those perfect beach vacations. Charlie, however, knows a different side to the destination: the action-packed side.

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.desc: Nicosia, the capital of the Republic of Cyprus is also its cultural heartbeat. Sabrina realizes this, as she sets out to unravel the stories of the largest city in Cyprus while being treated to a bath in a Hammam, which was formerly a church.

programme.title: Xplore Belgium
programme.desc: Market square of Bruges is lined up with restaurants and cafes. The city is also home to golden fries or french fries, but are originated in Belgium.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: The pillowy goodness of Bengali sweets is even more famous in India than some of Kolkata’s landmarks. Alex, however, sets out to discover the forgotten sweets of Bengal. She meets some veteran sweet shop owners in the city, who show her how to make some lesser-known traditional sweets.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Stay tuned with Alex to find out what Barc, the coastal town of Croatia, has to offer a backpacker. She tries quad biking.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.desc: Why do men camp in the great outdoors? Simply to get some peace and quiet. In this episode, watch Dan & Paddy’s day in Itoshima - a place with soothing waterfalls, fishing pools and perfect beach sunsets to calm the soul.

programme.title: Timeless Tamil Nadu
programme.desc: Alex is introduced to Tamil Nadu through the state capital, Chennai. A colonial-era cathedral that she visits turns out to be one of the only three known churches in the world built over the tomb of an apostle of Jesus. She also finds out that a museum dedicated to the life of a saint was once used by an American businessman to store ice. She soon realizes that the city is full of hidden stories waiting to be explored.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: The traditional hot stone bath of Bhutan claims to cleanse a person of no less than 80 skin ailments.

programme.title: Xplore Belgium
programme.desc: Brussels is one of the most cosmopolitan cities of Belgium and also its economic and political center. There are way too many things to do here.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.desc: The name Sakurajima means cherry blossom island - and that is the beguiling name of a fuming volcano in Kyushu. Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty try different ways to get up, close and personal with the volcano. What they don’t count on is an eruption.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: Alex visits Karni Fort and Fort Begu in Rajasthan, where she unearths some prized dishes of the nobilities.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico
programme.desc: Tulum, one of the last cities built and inhabited by the Mayans; Charlie narrates the stories about their reign.

programme.title: Timeless Tamil Nadu
programme.desc: Alex is introduced to Tamil Nadu through the state capital, Chennai. A colonial-era cathedral that she visits turns out to be one of the only three known churches in the world built over the tomb of an apostle of Jesus. She also finds out that a museum dedicated to the life of a saint was once used by an American businessman to store ice. She soon realizes that the city is full of hidden stories waiting to be explored.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: The traditional hot stone bath of Bhutan claims to cleanse a person of no less than 80 skin ailments.

programme.title: Xplore Belgium
programme.desc: Brussels is one of the most cosmopolitan cities of Belgium and also its economic and political center. There are way too many things to do here.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.desc: The name Sakurajima means cherry blossom island - and that is the beguiling name of a fuming volcano in Kyushu. Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty try different ways to get up, close and personal with the volcano. What they don’t count on is an eruption.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: Alex visits Karni Fort and Fort Begu in Rajasthan, where she unearths some prized dishes of the nobilities.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: Bengal has not only been home to the former capital of British India but also been the land where many European colonies vied for dominance and cultural supremacy. As a result, the cuisine of the land underwent a renaissance, wherein it imbibed many European influences including Portuguese, Dutch and Danish. Alex visits what used to be a Danish settlement on the banks of the river Hooghly, and she unearths recipes, which were born from this delicious amalgamation of cultures.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Alexandra, in this episode visits Dubrovnik, where she explores a war museum, the dramatic monuments, mesmerising landscapes and tries water sports.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico
programme.desc: Charlie’s journey across Mexico begins in La Paz, a quiet escape sitting on the Sea of Cortez that is often overshadowed by Cabo

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.desc: Larnaca in Cyprus is one of the world’s 20 most ancient, continuously inhabited cities for the last 4000 years. Travel enthusiast, Sabrina sets out to find out more about the city but is waylaid when she finds a flock of flamingos at a lake side.

programme.title: Xplore Belgium
programme.desc: The food, the beers, the chocolate and the fries. Bruges is one of the cities that seemed to have skipped 21st century altogether.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.desc: While the rest of Japan remained isolated from the world, Fukuoka’s global flavour was concocted by centuries of trade with its Asian neighbours. Adventurers, Daniel Coll and Paddy Doherty attend a unique baseball game at a rather offbeat stadium in Kyushu’s largest city.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: The pillowy goodness of Bengali sweets is even more famous in India than some of Kolkata’s landmarks. Alex, however, sets out to discover the forgotten sweets of Bengal. She meets some veteran sweet shop owners in the city, who show her how to make some lesser-known traditional sweets.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Stay tuned with Alex to find out what Barc, the coastal town of Croatia, has to offer a backpacker. She tries quad biking.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico
programme.desc: People flock to Cabo for those perfect beach vacations. Charlie, however, knows a different side to the destination: the action-packed side.

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.desc: Nicosia, the capital of the Republic of Cyprus is also its cultural heartbeat. Sabrina realizes this, as she sets out to unravel the stories of the largest city in Cyprus while being treated to a bath in a Hammam, which was formerly a church.

programme.title: Xplore Belgium
programme.desc: Market square of Bruges is lined up with restaurants and cafes. The city is also home to golden fries or french fries, but are originated in Belgium.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.desc: Why do men camp in the great outdoors? Simply to get some peace and quiet. In this episode, watch Dan & Paddy’s day in Itoshima - a place with soothing waterfalls, fishing pools and perfect beach sunsets to calm the soul.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: Khad Maas is a celebrated Rajasthani dish with war-time origins. Game meat used to be slow-cooked in underground pits created to ensure that the fire could not be seen by enemy troops. Due to its intricate and cumbersome preparation, the dish seldom graces tables in Rajasthan today. Alex learns how to prepare this with the cultural conservationist, Trivikram.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Explore the beautiful Dalmatian coast with a little history of Split with Alex and stay tuned as next she explores the port city of Salona.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico
programme.desc: From dolphin-filled lagoons to colonial charm, Charlie introduces the treasures of the least visited state on the Yucatan peninsula, Campeche.

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.desc: In the Troodos ranges of Cyprus, Sabrina Chakici visits the Kykkos Monastery and the ten small village churches, which have become a UNESCO World Heritage Site. She further ventures out to explore the Neolithic village of Khirokitia and learn about the age-old lace tradition in Lefkara village.

programme.title: Xplore Belgium
programme.desc: Renowned as the world's leading city of diamonds, it also holds about possessing the second largest port in whole of Europe.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.desc: Tea in Japan is a spiritual concept. Attaching ritual and ceremony to it, this country transforms the act of drinking tea to a moment of communion with the universe. Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty find out different ways to relish Gyokuro tea, one of the highest grades of tea available in Japan. They also visit the village where it is grown.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: The sheer ingenuity and artistry of Rajasthani cuisine is an enduring testament to the skill and grim determination of the people who have made their homes in this largely arid land. Alex finds out that this applies to the imperial cuisine of the state as well, when she meets Trivikram and learns from him how to prepare a traditional meat dish, that was made using meat leftovers.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Watch a musical instrument powered by sea waves and learn how glassware was made in Roman era. This and more with Alexandra in Zadar episode

programme.title: Viajar Mexico
programme.desc: In the historic city of Merida, Charlie shows around the underground pools, which narrate stories of Mayan beliefs.

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.desc: Lying next to the island's beautiful Mediterranean coastline, in south-western Cyprus, the popular town of Paphos is home to some spectacular archaeological attractions and a rich Cypriot history. Here, Sabrina discovers the myths of the Greek and Roman philosophies, unravels the stories hidden in time at Paphos Archaeological Park, and explores the historic towns of Limassol and Kourion.

programme.title: Xplore Belgium
programme.desc: Antwerp has grown on the banks of the Scheldt River that alongwith the Meuse and the Rhine forms the biggest estuary in western Europe.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.desc: Among Japan’s best kept secrets is its very own Venice with an oriental flavour to it. Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty visit this hidden gem, and learn a little about Kyushu’s history and Samurai, the legendary Japanese warriors. They also witness an enchanting garden, that is the perfect combination of the creativity of nature and human beings.

programme.title: My Talented Friends Season 1
programme.desc: Ornella Fado introduce il suo amico Geniale Sergio Furnari, e presenta un docuemntario su un suo ultimo lavoro aritistico "Covid Hero Monument"

programme.title: Eccellenze Italiane con Piero Muscari intervista a Heinz Beck
programme.desc: Pietro Muscari intervista Lorenzo Suraci, Presidente di RTL 102.5. Lorenzo rivela come ha iniziato a lavorare con celebrità come Maurizio Costanzo e Bruno Vespa e quali sono i progetti futuri per la prima radio in Italia.

programme.title: Eccellenze Italiane con Piero Muscari intervista a Heinz Beck
programme.desc: Pietro Muscari intervista Enrico Vaime, autore e conduttore radio e TV. Con Enrico si parla di radio, tv, libri, ma anche di amore e dispiaceri che hanno formato la sua carriera.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita Washington DC e va a scoprire un ristorante proprio a due passi dalla Casa Bianca, il ristorante si chiama "Luigino", il proprietario e chef è Carmine Marzano. Chef Marzano prepara delle ricette tipiche piemontesi. Ospite della trasmissione la bellissima Adrianna Sgarlata Miss Virginia 2006. (2006)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita chef Cesare Casella nel suo ristorante nel Village "Maremma" per preparare alcune delle sue ricette preferite. Con Cesare Ornella visita upstate un allevamento di maiali e mucche Chianine. Cesare Casella oltre ad essere un bravissimo chef è anche uno stimatissimo insegnate, è infatti il Dean del programma di cucina italiana all' "International Culinary Center" a Soho ed Ornella è andata a trovarlo con le telecamere di Brindiamo!.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita il ristorante "Il Circo" nel cuore di Manhattan, dove conosce la signora Egidiana autrice di diversi libri di cucina. Dopo aver preprato alcune specialità del ristorante, Ornella visita il Re della ristorazione francese al ristornate Le Cirque. Il Signore Mauro Maccioni in una intervsita racconta ad Ornella la sua favolosa carriera nella ristorazione.(2007)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita il ristorante toscano "Pepolino" dove prepara delle saporite ricette con lo chef Patrizio, per chiudere in "Dolcezza e Bellezza" Enzo prepara una delle cheese cake piu` famose di New York.(2007).

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova nel laboratorio di Urbani Truffle a New York ed invita i suoi amici chef per preparare insieme delle ricette da gustare durante le festività natalizie. In questa puntata Chef Pino Coladonato, Chef Marcello Russodivito e la giovane pizzaiola Giorgia Caporuscio. In questa edizione di Brindiamo! in my Kitchen ospite speciale la soprano Cristina Fontanelli e John La Barbera, oltre a vari ospiti del mondo dello spettacolo, e della moda. (2016)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova nel laboratorio di Urbani Truffle a New York per la serconda parte di Brindiamo! in my kitchen. I suoi amici chef in questa puntata son lo chef Raffaele Ronca, lo Chef Marco Chirico e il giovane pizzaiolo Ettore Toches. In questa edizione di Brindiamo! in my Kitchen la musica è dal vivo con la soprano Cristina Fontanelli ed il compositore Jhon La Barbera, tra gli ospiti di questa puntata il Fashion designer Domenico Vacca. (2016)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado visita cinque amici ristoratori durante le feste Natalizie, prima tappa" Angelina's" a Staten Island, poi e` la volta di "Marco Polo" e "Luzzo" a Brooklyn. A Manhattan nell'Upper East side, Ornella visita "83 e mezza". Ultima tappa per ujn buon gelato,"Dolce Gelateria" nel Village. (2013)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado continua il suo giro per incontrare il suoi amici ristoratori durante le festività di capodanno. Visitando a midtown Chef Pino alla "La Masseria", chef Stefano e Franco a " Viceversa", a "PizzArte" incontra il pizzaiolo Roberto ed il proprietario Dario, a Queens visita "Ornella Trattoria" dove incontra Vincenzo e "Trattoria l'Incontro"dove incontra lo chef e proprietario Rocco. (2013/2014)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: La puntata di oggi è ricca di contenuti. Ornella Fado incontra Cristina Carrani, esperta in materia immobiliare che aiuterà Ornella a scoprire l'Isola di Capri. Dalla moda alla storia, al cibo e all'arte, Brindiamo! Edizione speciale Capri è l'episodio perfetto per festeggiare i 18 anni di Brindiamo! su NYC LIFE.

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, visita il ristorante "Angelina's" di Angelina Malerba. Il ristorante si trova a Staten Island un dei 5 distretti di New York, e Angelina afferma: "Qui mi sento come se fossi nella mia amata Sicilia dato che ho il mare di fronte". Con lo chef Marco Zuccalà, Ornella prepara alcune ricette tipiche siciliane.(2010)

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, visita il ristorante stellato "Madonnina del Pescatore", a Senigallia. Insieme a chef Moreno Cedroni preparano delle ricette belle da vedere e deliziose da mangiare.In questa puntata Ornella è ospite all'inaugurazione della cantina di Domodimonti nelle Marche.(2010)

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, visita una pizzeria "Olio Pizza e Più" nel Village a Manhattan, dove incontra master pizzaiolo Giulio Adriani, campione mondiale di pizza margherita. Oltre a preparare favole pizze, Ornella incontra Edoardo Bennato all'istituto Italiano di Cultura di New York ed insieme cantano alcuni brani famosissimi. (2010)

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, visita uno dei ristoranti piu` longevi di Brooklyn,"Marco Polo" ma prima di entrare nella cucina per preparare alcune ricette del ristorante con l'excutive chef Bruno Miloni e chef Marco Chirico, Ornella visita i famoso mercato del pesce nel Bronx con Giuseppe Chirico (proprietario del ristorante) e suo figlio Marco. In questo epsiodio Ornella ha anche il piacere di intervistare il cantautore Ron, al secolo Rosallino Cellamare. (2011)

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, visita lo Chef Marcello Russodivito, al ristorante "Marcello's" in Suffern. Marcello prepara delle ricette tratte dal sul libro di cucina, inclusa la ricetta dedicata ad i 150 anni dell'Unita`d' Italia. Per festeggiare i 25 anni di carriera di Marcello, Ornella presenta un favolo concerto al teatro storico La Fayette nella città di Suffern. (2011)

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado visita uno dei ristoranti carichi di storia e tradizione della città di Acqui Terme, "Parisio 1933", dove lo chef e proprietario Maurizio Parisio prepara delle semplicissime e gustose ricette. Ospite della trasmissione l'artista Omar Ronda. Ornella ha fatto un tour della citta` con il vice sindaco Enrico Sivlio Bertero.(2011)

programme.title: Change your Destiny
programme.desc: Nella prima puntata Antonio Fini ed i suoi giudici incontrano il primo gruppo di ballerini.Per essere selezionati per il prestigioso festival di danza in NEW YORK devono affrontare 3 sfide: presentare il loro pezzo migliore, la contemporary battle e la lezione di danza "tecnica Graham" con il maestro Antonio Fini.

programme.title: Change your Destiny
programme.desc: Terza ed ultima puntata della serie. Antonio Fini ed i suoi giudici sono pronti: chi sceglieranno per volare a NEW YORK per il prestigioso festival della danza? Ancora una volta i ragazzi devono convincere l'importante giuria con il loro pezzo migliore, la contemporary battle e la lezione di danza "tecnica Parson" con la maestra Abby Silva.

programme.title: Il CIRCOLO DEL BUONGUSTAI Con Fabio Campoli
programme.desc: Benvenuti a questo nuovo episodio del Circolo dei Buongustai! Cosa bolle in pentola? Oggi il nostro chef Fabio Campoli ci delizierà con tre ricette speciali: cono di stesa, venere nera, e babà al bergamotto. Buona visione a tutti!

programme.title: Il CIRCOLO DEL BUONGUSTAI Con Fabio Campoli
programme.desc: Benvenuti a questo nuovo episodio del Circolo dei Buongustai! Cosa bolle in pentola? Oggi il nostro chef Fabio Campoli ci delizierà con tre ricette speciali: portafoglio di squacquerone, ciliegie e mortadella, riso rosso integrale con pollo e peperoni, diplomatico alle rose. Buona visione a tutti!

programme.title: My Talented Friends Season 1
programme.desc: Ornella Fado presenta il lavoro artistico della sua amica Geniale,Paola Sinisgalli fondatrice della "Creative Shakes" il lavoro artistico di oggi e` un corto che vede Paola nei panni di regista.

programme.title: My Talented Friends Season 1
programme.desc: Ornella Fado introduce il suo amico Geniale Sergio Furnari, e presenta un docuemntario su un suo ultimo lavoro aritistico "Covid Hero Monument"

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado visita cinque amici ristoratori durante le feste Natalizie, prima tappa" Angelina's" a Staten Island, poi e` la volta di "Marco Polo" e "Luzzo" a Brooklyn. A Manhattan nell'Upper East side, Ornella visita "83 e mezza". Ultima tappa per ujn buon gelato,"Dolce Gelateria" nel Village. (2013)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita Raffaele Trovato, direttore dell'IFSE, a Piobesi Torinese, oltre a visitare la bellissima scuola, Ornella prepara delle ricette con l'istruttore del centro.(2009)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita il ristorante "Il Tartufo" a Manayunk, poco distante da Filadelfia, dove incontra Al Del Bello, per preparare alcune ricette tipiche del ristorante. In questa puntata Ornella indossa i guanti da boxer per correre come Rocky Balboa sulla scalinata del museo d'arte di Filadelfia. (2007)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita Al Del Bello al suo ristorante "Il Portico", uno dei ristoranti più raffinati di Filadelfia. Al racconta la sua storia di gratidudine nei confronti della famiglia Lattanzi proprietari di ristoratori italiani a New York. (2006)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado incontra chef Rocco Sacramone al ristorante Trattoria "l'Incontro", Chef Rocco, condivide alcune delle ricette più amate dai suoi clienti incluso una dolcissima pizza alla nutella. (2008)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado incontra un vero gentiluomo della ristorazione italiana a Filadelfia, Giuseppe Giuliani, patron de "La Buca". Giuseppe oltre a preparare alcune ricette toscane, racconta l'avventura dell'apertura atipica e fuori programma del ristorante per ospitare il Maestro Luciano Pavarotti in tour a Filadelfia.(2006)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: La puntata di oggi è ricca di contenuti. Ornella Fado incontra Cristina Carrani, esperta in materia immobiliare che aiuterà Ornella a scoprire l'Isola di Capri. programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita Gente, dove incontra Jay Mitchel un americano appassionato di Italia al punto di aprire un suo ristorante in america per far apprezzare il cibo Italiano ad i suoi clienti.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita il ristorante Barolo, nel cuore di Soho ed incontra il proprietario Paolo Secondo, che oltre a preparare una squsita focaccia Genovese, racconta la sua storia di giovane imprenditore italiano a New York.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage.Ornella Fado, visita il ristorante stellato Cascinale Novo, dove incontra chef Walter Ferreto e preparano delle tipiche ricette Piemontesi. Ornella inoltre visitare la casa del Trifolao di Natale Romagnolo per una caccia al tartufo Bianco.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita uno dei ristoranti più eleganti di Manhattan a due passi da Central Park il "San Domenico ristorante". Nella cucina del ristorante Ornella assiste Odette Fada nella preparazione dei classici piatti Italiani. Ospite della puntata la giovane stilista Nicole Romano. Ornella Fado indossa alcune creazioni della sua collezione. (2007)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita una delle più belle scuole di cucine upstate in New York la "CIA" Culinary Institute of America, dove visita il ristorante "Caterina dei Medici", e con lo chef Scapin preprano alcune ricette del menù della scuola. (2007)

programme.title: Eccellenze Italiane con Piero Muscari intervista a Heinz Beck
programme.desc: Pietro Muscari intervista la regista e sceneggiatrice Lina Wertmüller. Prima donna nella storia ad essere candidata all' Oscar come miglior regista, Lina racconta il suo rapporto con grandi personaggi del cinema come Lelio Luttazzi e Federico Fellini.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova a Roma e visita nel cuore di Roma a Piazza Navona il ristorante stellato "Il Convivio di Troiani" dello Chef Massimo Troiani. Insieme allo Chef Daniele Lippi cucinano dei piatti gustosi, quanto raffinati. Ornella intervista Massimo Troiani e partecipa come "USA Ambassador " alla serata di gala "Eccellenze Italiane" presso "La Pergola" dei Cavalieri Hilton, intervistando Il re degli Chef Heniz Beck.

programme.title: My Talented Friends Season 1
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, passa una giornata a New York con il suo amico Geniale, il Maestro Antonio Ciacca, e tra una chiacchierata a Lincoln Center ed una passeggiata a Central Park, arrivano al prestigiosto Pier Hotel dove il Maestro Ciacca si esibisce regolarmente. in questo episodio di "MY TALENTED FRIENDS" scoprirete la storia di successo del Maestro Ciacca in un pccolo documentario MY JAZZ LIFE.

programme.title: My Talented Friends Season 1
programme.desc: Ornella Fado introduce il suo amico Geniale Julian Gargiulo, un talentuosissimo compositore e pianista on uno spiccato senso dell'umore, Julian e` il protagnosita e regista di un documentario girato al Carnegie Hall di New York, durante una competizione ideada dal maestro Gargiiulo.

programme.title: Il CIRCOLO DEL BUONGUSTAI Con Fabio Campoli
programme.desc: Benvenuti a questo nuovo episodio del Circolo dei Buongustai! Cosa bolle in pentola? Oggi il nostro chef Fabio Campoli ci delizierà con tre ricette speciali: rotolo di riso, prosciutto e melone, risotto alla rucola con kiwi e vongole, e budino di riso. Buona visione a tutti!

programme.desc: Benvenuti a questo nuovo episodio del Circolo dei Buongustai! Cosa bolle in pentola? Oggi il nostro chef Fabio Campoli ci delizierà con tre ricette speciali: cono di stesa, venere nera, e babà al bergamotto. Buona visione a tutti!

programme.title: Change your Destiny
programme.desc: Nella prima puntata Antonio Fini ed i suoi giudici incontrano il primo gruppo di ballerini.Per essere selezionati per il prestigioso festival di danza in NEW YORK devono affrontare 3 sfide: presentare il loro pezzo migliore, la contemporary battle e la lezione di danza "tecnica Graham" con il maestro Antonio Fini.

programme.title: Change your Destiny
programme.desc: Continuano le audizioni di Antonio Fini e dei suoi giudici per selezionare i migliori danzatori da invitare al prestigioso festival di danza in NEW YORK. I ragazzi affrontano le tre sfide previste: portare il loro pezzo migliore, la contemporary battle e la lezione di Hip hop con Mirco Giordano e Marcello Gargarelli.

programme.title: Change your Destiny
programme.desc: Terza ed ultima puntata della serie. Antonio Fini ed i suoi giudici sono pronti: chi sceglieranno per volare a NEW YORK per il prestigioso festival della danza? Ancora una volta i ragazzi devono convincere l'importante giuria con il loro pezzo migliore, la contemporary battle e la lezione di danza "tecnica Parson" con la maestra Abby Silva.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado visita cinque amici ristoratori durante le feste Natalizie, prima tappa" Angelina's" a Staten Island, poi e` la volta di "Marco Polo" e "Luzzo" a Brooklyn. A Manhattan nell'Upper East side, Ornella visita "83 e mezza". Ultima tappa per ujn buon gelato,"Dolce Gelateria" nel Village. (2013)

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova in Piemonte, e visita il ristorante stellato "Donatella" ad Oviglio. Con Donatella e il sous chef Iacopo preparano delle ricette con il Brachetto d'Acqui, e nel giardino del ristorante intervista Mauro e Donatella. In questa puntata Ornella visita la famiglia Ricagno, durante il periodo della vendemmia, e incontra Paolo Lovisolo alla cantina Bersano, provando l'emozione di pigiare l'uva brachetto.( 2011)

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado visita una pizzeria nel cuore di Manhattan "Don Antonio by Starita". Roberto e Giorgia Caporusscio preparano pizze tradizionali, e pizze dedicate per i fan di Brindiamo! Grazie a Skipe Ornella saluta il master pizzaiolo Don Antonio Starita nella sua pizzeria a Napoli. (2012)

programme.title: BrindiamoS3
programme.desc: Ornella Fado è in crociera alla scoperta di ristoranti autentici Italiani nel mondo. In questa prima parte delle mini serie "Brindiamo! On the Sea", Ornella salpa sulla nave della MSC "Poesia" da New York per raggiungere Halifax in Canada, dove visita il ristorante "Ladri di Biciclette" e prepara alcune deliziose ricette con lo chef Maurizo Bertossi. A bordo della MSC Poesia. Intervista il Capitano Giacomo Romano ed Il Direttore "food & beverage". Enzo Di Simone.

programme.title: BrindiamoS3
programme.desc: Ornella Fado continua la sua favolsa crociera ospite della MSC crociera, questa volta è diretta a Boston dove visita il ristorante "Pasta Beach" e prepara deliziose ricette con gli chef Andrea Borio, Marco Minieri e Allison Kimmel, sulla nave intervista il Direttore dell'hotel della MSC crociere,Gianfranco Sampiero. Ornella è anche ospite con Sergio Brio del Gala della Juventus che si tiene ogni anno a Boston.

programme.title: BrindiamoS3
programme.desc: Ornella Fado visita la città canadese di Montreal alla scoperta dei ristoranti autentici e italiani di successo. A Montreal conosce Aldo Vincenzo, un uomo d'affari appassionato di cucina, che ha aperto una pizzeria ed un ristorante "Vinizza", molto apprezzati in città. In questa puntata Ornella intervista un suo carissimo amico e grande artista, Massimo Ranieri in tour a New York. (2012)

programme.title: BrindiamoS3
programme.desc: Ornella Fado visita il relais "Villa d'Amelia" nel cuore delle Langhe in Piemonte, dove incontra lo chef stellato Damiano Nigro. Chef Nigro prepara delle ricette tipiche del territorio, e dopo una mattinata in cucina si rilassano e brindano alla vita. (2012)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita uno dei ristoranti più eleganti di Manhattan a due passi da Central Park il "San Domenico ristorante". Nella cucina del ristorante Ornella assiste Odette Fada nella preparazione dei classici piatti Italiani. Ospite della puntata la giovane stilista Nicole Romano. Ornella Fado indossa alcune creazioni della sua collezione. (2007)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita una delle più belle scuole di cucine upstate in New York la "CIA" Culinary Institute of America, dove visita il ristorante "Caterina dei Medici", e con lo chef Scapin preprano alcune ricette del menù della scuola. (2007)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita Raffaele Trovato, direttore dell'IFSE, a Piobesi Torinese, oltre a visitare la bellissima scuola, Ornella prepara delle ricette con l'istruttore del centro.(2009)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita il ristorante "Il Tartufo" a Manayunk, poco distante da Filadelfia, dove incontra Al Del Bello, per preparare alcune ricette tipiche del ristorante. In questa puntata Ornella indossa i guanti da boxer per correre come Rocky Balboa sulla scalinata del museo d'arte di Filadelfia. (2007)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova a Milano esattamente all'EXPO. Incontra un gruppo di ragazzi della regione Basilicata, che partecipano al progetto "Sano è Lucano", e hanno portato alcuni prodotti tipici della regione Basilicata, che Ornella utilizza per cucinare alcune ricette con Jasmin sulla barca, con Antonio alla libreria Mondadori di Milano, con Nicolò a "Lady Bu Bistrò", e con Fabio Pisani al ristorante stellato di Aimo e Nadia.(2015)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova in una delle città più belle al mondo, Venezia, e visita il "Centurion Palace", dove incontra lo chef veneziano Massimo Livan al ristorante "Antinoo's Lounge". Con chef Massimo, Ornella prepara dei piatti ispirati ai dipinti d' arte moderna. Durante la visita al "Centurion Palace" incontra il General Manager Paolo Morra, e davanti ad un cocktail tutto veneziano Paolo racconta la storia di questo storico palazzo. (2015)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova in Florida ospite di un eccezionale evento organizzato da Ursula Avella Presidente di "Great Culinary Minds". L 'evento si è svolto al ristorante "Valentino Cucina Italiana". Ospite di Ornella è il talentuoso chef Mauro Uliassi, all'epoca 2 stelle Michelin, ora 3. Ospite d'eccezione di questa puntata il cantautore Raf che incontra Ornella su una spiaggia di Miami. (2015)

programme.title: Eccellenze Italiane con Piero Muscari intervista a Heinz Beck
programme.desc: Pietro Muscari intervista la regista e sceneggiatrice Lina Wertmüller. Prima donna nella storia ad essere candidata all' Oscar come miglior regista, Lina racconta il suo rapporto con grandi personaggi del cinema come Lelio Luttazzi e Federico Fellini.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova a Roma e visita nel cuore di Roma a Piazza Navona il ristorante stellato "Il Convivio di Troiani" dello Chef Massimo Troiani. Insieme allo Chef Daniele Lippi cucinano dei piatti gustosi, quanto raffinati. Ornella intervista Massimo Troiani e partecipa come "USA Ambassador " alla serata di gala "Eccellenze Italiane" presso "La Pergola" dei Cavalieri Hilton, intervistando Il re degli Chef Heniz Beck.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado visita cinque amici ristoratori durante le feste Natalizie, prima tappa" Angelina's" a Staten Island, poi e` la volta di "Marco Polo" e "Luzzo" a Brooklyn. A Manhattan nell'Upper East side, Ornella visita "83 e mezza". Ultima tappa per ujn buon gelato,"Dolce Gelateria" nel Village. (2013)

programme.title: Il CIRCOLO DEL BUONGUSTAI Con Fabio Campoli

Oggi il nostro chef Fabio Campoli ci delizierà con tre ricette speciali: portafoglio di squacquerone, ciliegie e mortadella, riso rosso integrale con pollo e peperoni, diplomatico alle rose. Buona visione a tutti!

programme.title: Il CIRCOLO DEL BUONGUSTAI Con Fabio Campoli
programme.desc: Benvenuti a questo nuovo episodio del Circolo dei Buongustai! Cosa bolle in pentola? Oggi il nostro chef Fabio Campoli ci delizierà con tre ricette speciali: rotolo di riso, prosciutto e melone, risotto alla rucola con kiwi e vongole, e budino di riso. Buona visione a tutti!

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: La puntata di oggi è ricca di contenuti. Ornella Fado incontra Cristina Carrani, esperta in materia immobiliare che aiuterà Ornella a scoprire l'Isola di Capri. Dalla moda alla storia, al cibo e all'arte, Brindiamo! Edizione speciale Capri è l'episodio perfetto per festeggiare i 18 anni di Brindiamo! su NYC LIFE.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova nel laboratorio di Urbani Truffle a New York ed invita i suoi amici chef per preparare insieme delle ricette da gustare durante le festività natalizie. In questa puntata Chef Pino Coladonato, Chef Marcello Russodivito e la giovane pizzaiola Giorgia Caporuscio. In questa edizione di Brindiamo! in my Kitchen ospite speciale la soprano Cristina Fontanelli e John La Barbera, oltre a vari ospiti del mondo dello spettacolo, e della moda. (2016)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova nel laboratorio di Urbani Truffle a New York per la serconda parte di Brindiamo! in my kitchen. I suoi amici chef in questa puntata son lo chef Raffaele Ronca, lo Chef Marco Chirico e il giovane pizzaiolo Ettore Toches. In questa edizione di Brindiamo! in my Kitchen la musica è dal vivo con la soprano Cristina Fontanelli ed il compositore Jhon La Barbera, tra gli ospiti di questa puntata il Fashion designer Domenico Vacca. (2016)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado visita cinque amici ristoratori durante le feste Natalizie, prima tappa" Angelina's" a Staten Island, poi e` la volta di "Marco Polo" e "Luzzo" a Brooklyn. A Manhattan nell'Upper East side, Ornella visita "83 e mezza". Ultima tappa per ujn buon gelato,"Dolce Gelateria" nel Village. (2013)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado continua il suo giro per incontrare il suoi amici ristoratori durante le festività di capodanno. Visitando a midtown Chef Pino alla "La Masseria", chef Stefano e Franco a " Viceversa", a "PizzArte" incontra il pizzaiolo Roberto ed il proprietario Dario, a Queens visita "Ornella Trattoria" dove incontra Vincenzo e "Trattoria l'Incontro"dove incontra lo chef e proprietario Rocco. (2013/2014)

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, visita uno dei ristoranti piu` longevi di Brooklyn,"Marco Polo" ma prima di entrare nella cucina per preparare alcune ricette del ristorante con l'excutive chef Bruno Miloni e chef Marco Chirico, Ornella visita i famoso mercato del pesce nel Bronx con Giuseppe Chirico (proprietario del ristorante) e suo figlio Marco. In questo epsiodio Ornella ha anche il piacere di intervistare il cantautore Ron, al secolo Rosallino Cellamare. (2011)

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, visita lo Chef Marcello Russodivito, al ristorante "Marcello's" in Suffern. Marcello prepara delle ricette tratte dal sul libro di cucina, inclusa la ricetta dedicata ad i 150 anni dell'Unita`d' Italia. Per festeggiare i 25 anni di carriera di Marcello, Ornella presenta un favolo concerto al teatro storico La Fayette nella città di Suffern. (2011)

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado visita uno dei ristoranti carichi di storia e tradizione della città di Acqui Terme, "Parisio 1933", dove lo chef e proprietario Maurizio Parisio prepara delle semplicissime e gustose ricette. Ospite della trasmissione l'artista Omar Ronda. Ornella ha fatto un tour della citta` con il vice sindaco Enrico Sivlio Bertero.(2011)
